body:
# Marionette

Marionette is a Crystal shard that replaces the functionality of Selenium (Firefox only for now) by communicating directly with an instance of the browser. It provides a simple, but powerful API which allows everything from navigation to screenshots to executing JavaScript.

## Installation

Add this to your application's `shard.yml`:

```yaml
dependencies:
  marionette:
    github: watzon/marionette
```

## Usage

```crystal
require "marionette"

# Marionette.launch launches a Firefox browser and exposes
# it to the block. The browser automatically closes after
# the block is finished.
Marionette.launch do
  goto("https://watzon.tech")
  save_screenshot("watzon-tech.jpg")
end

# Marionette.launch can also be used without a block. This
# method requires that you close the browser yourself.
browser = Marionette.launch
browser.goto("https://watzon.tech")
browser.save_screenshot("watzon-tech.jpg")
browser.quit
```

### Launch options

`Marionette.launch` accepts all the same arguments as `Launcher#launch`. These arguments are:

- **address** - The address that Firefox is listening on. (default: 127.0.0.1)
- **port** - The port that Firefox is listening on. (default: 2828)
- **executable** - The executable to launch. If `nil` an executable will be searched for. If `false` no executable will be launched.
- **args** - Arguments to pass to the Firefox process (only if **executable** is not false)
- **profile** - User profile path to launch with (only if **executable** is not false)
- **headless** - Launch browser in headless mode (default: true) (only if **executable** is not false)
- **stdout** - `IO` to use for STDOUT (only if **executable** is not false)
- **stderr** - `IO` to use for STDERR (only if **executable** is not false)
- **accept_insecure_certs** - Open all connections, even if the cert is invalid
- **env** - Environment to pass to `Process` (only if **executable** is not false)
- **default_viewport** - Default size of the browser window (default: {width: 800, height: 600})
- **timeout** - Universal timeout (default: 60000)
- **proxy** - NamedTuple with `address` and `port` for proxy.

### Browser

`Launcher#launch` returns a `Browser` instance which is responsible for most of Marionette's functionality. It includes a number of methods which can be found [here](https://watzon.github.io/marionette/Marionette/Browser.html).

## Contributing

1. Fork it ( https://github.com/watzon/marionette/fork )
2. Create your feature branch (git checkout -b my-new-feature)
3. Commit your changes (git commit -am 'Add some feature')
4. Push to the branch (git push origin my-new-feature)
5. Create a new Pull Request

## Contributors

- [watzon](https://github.com/watzon)  - creator, maintainer

instance_methods.name: launch
instance_methods.doc: See `Launcher#launch`
instance_methods.summary: See Launcher#launch

def.name: launch
def.body:
browser = Launcher.new.launch(**options)
with browser yield browser
if options[:executable]? == false
else
  browser.quit
end

types.name: Actions
types.doc:
API for creating and performing action sequences.
Each action method adds one or more actions to a queue. When `#perform`
is called, the queued actions fire in order.
types.summary: API for creating and performing action sequences.

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (browser : Browser, action_type : ActionType, input_id, pointer_params = nil)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(browser, action_type, input_id, pointer_params)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.name: click
def.body:
if element
  pointer_move(0, 0, origin: element)
end
(pointer_down(button)).pointer_up(button)

def.name: pointer_move
def.body:
action = Action {"type" => "pointerMove", "x" => x, "y" => y}
if duration
  action = action.merge(Action {"duration" => duration})
end
if origin
  if origin.is_a?(Browser::WebElement)
    action = action.merge(Action {"origin" => Action {Browser::WEB_ELEMENT_KEY => origin.id}})
  else
    action["origin"] = origin
  end
end
queue.push(action)
self

def.name: sendKeys
def.body:
keys.each do |key|
  key_down(key)
  key_up(key)
end
self

response.try(&.[]("value"))

instance_methods.name: find_element
instance_methods.doc:
Find a single element using the indicated search strategy and
starting with a particular node.
instance_methods.summary: Find a single element using the indicated search strategy and starting with a particular node.

def.name: find_element
def.body:
begin
  if start_node.nil? || start_node.empty?
    params = {using: by.to_s, value: value}
  else
    params = {using: by.to_s, value: value, element: start_node}
  end
  response = @transport.request("WebDriver:FindElement", params)
  HTMLElement.new(self, response["value"].as_h.first[1].as_s)
rescue
  nil
end

instance_methods.name: find_element
instance_methods.doc: Find a single element using the indicated search strategy.
instance_methods.summary: Find a single element using the indicated search strategy.

instance_methods.name: find_elements
instance_methods.doc:
Find elements using the indicated search strategy and
starting with a particular node.
instance_methods.summary: Find elements using the indicated search strategy and starting with a particular node.

def.name: find_elements
def.body:
begin
  if start_node.nil? || start_node.empty?
    params = {using: by.to_s, value: value}
  else
    params = {using: by.to_s, value: value, element: start_node}
  end
  response = @transport.request("WebDriver:FindElements", params)
  response.params.as_a.map do |__arg1|
    __arg1.as_h.to_a
  end.map do |a|
    HTMLElement.new(self, a[0][1].as_s)
  end
rescue
  [] of HTMLElement
end

NOTE: Not working yet

def.name: restart
def.body:
debug("Restarting browser")
response = request_in_app_shutdown(["eRestart"])
error = true
while error
  begin
    @transport.request("Marionette:AcceptConnections", {value: true})
    error = false
  rescue
  end
end
response

instance_methods.name: take_screenshot
instance_methods.doc:
Takes a screenshot of an element or the current frame.
Optionally also allows you to highlight specific elements.
Format can be `:hash`, :binary, or `:base64` (default).
instance_methods.summary: Takes a screenshot of an element or the current frame.
instance_methods.args_string: (element = nil, highlights = nil, full = true, scroll = true, format = ScreenshotFormat::Binary)

def.name: take_screenshot
def.body:
element = element.is_a?(HTMLElement) ? element.id : element
highlights.try(&.map do |el|
  el.is_a?(HTMLElement) ? el.id : el
end)
params = {id: element, highlights: highlights, full: full, scroll: scroll, hash: format == (:hash)}
debug("Taking screenshot")
response = @transport.request("WebDriver:TakeScreenshot", params)
data = response["value"].as_s
case format
when ScreenshotFormat::Binary
  Base64.decode_string(data)
else
  data
end

Create a new downloader instance with the specified
`download_dir` and `download_host`
constructors.summary: Create a new downloader instance with the specified #download_dir and #download_host

instance_methods.name: can_download?
instance_methods.doc:
Determine if a download exists for the given
`platform` and `revision`
instance_methods.summary: Determine if a download exists for the given platform and revision

def.name: can_download?
def.body:
url = get_download_url(platform, revision)
res = HTTP::Client.head(url, tls: nil)
res.status_code == 200

instance_methods.name: download
instance_methods.doc:
Executes a download for the given `platform` and
`revision`. If they are nil the defaults will
be downloaded.
instance_methods.summary: Executes a download for the given platform and revision.

def.name: download
def.body:
url = get_download_url(platform, revision)
zip_path = File.join(@download_dir, "download-#{platform}-#{revision}.zip")
folder_path = get_folder_path(platform, revision)
debug("Starting download of headless chrome for #{platform}, revision #{revision}")
if Dir.exists?(folder_path)
  debug("Directory at #{folder_path} already exists. Skipping download.")
  return
end
if !(Dir.exists?(@download_dir))
  debug("Making directory #{@download_dir}")
  Dir.mkdir(@download_dir)
end
debug("Downloading headless chrome")
HTTP::Client.get(url, tls: nil) do |response|
  File.write(zip_path, response.body_io)
  debug("Extracting chrome to #{folder_path}")
  Zip::File.open(zip_path) do |zip|
    zip.extract_all(folder_path, 30583)
  end
  debug("Deleting zip file")
  File.delete(zip_path)
end

instance_methods.name: download_dir
instance_methods.doc: Returns the downloads folder for this downloader.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the downloads folder for this downloader.

The host from which to download the headless
Chromium instance.
instance_methods.summary: The host from which to download the headless Chromium instance.

instance_methods.doc: List downloaded revisions
instance_methods.summary: List downloaded revisions

def.name: downloaded_revisions
def.body:
if Dir.exists?(@download_dir)
  (Dir.entries(@download_dir)).reject! do |f|
    [".", ".."].includes?(f)
  end
else
  [] of String
end

instance_methods.name: remove_revision
instance_methods.doc: Remove a specific revision
instance_methods.summary: Remove a specific revision

def.name: remove_revision
def.body:
if DOWNLOAD_URLS.has_key?(platform)
else
  raise("Unknown platform '#{platform}'")
end
folder_path = get_folder_path(platform, revision)
if Dir.exists?(folder_path)
  `rm -rf #{folder_path}`
end

instance_methods.name: revision_info
instance_methods.doc: Gets the information for a specific revision
instance_methods.summary: Gets the information for a specific revision

def.name: revision_info
def.body:
if DOWNLOAD_URLS.has_key?(platform)
else
  raise("Unknown platform '#{platform}'")
end
folder_path = get_folder_path(platform, revision)
exe_path = case platform.to_s
when "linux"
  File.join(folder_path, "chrome-linux", "chrome")
when "mac"
  File.join(folder_path, "chrome-mac", "Chromium.app", "Contents", "MacOS", "Chromium")
when "win32", "win64"
  File.join(folder_path, "chrome-win32", "chrome.exe")
else
  raise("Unknown platform '#{platform}'")
end
{revision: revision, executable_path: exe_path, folder_path: folder_path, downloaded: Dir.exists?(folder_path)}

def.name: new
def.body:
instance = allocate
instance.initialize(__pull_for_json_serializable: pull)
if instance.responds_to?(:finalize)
  GC.add_finalizer(instance)
end
instance

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Creates a new `Launcher` instance in the specified `project_root`.
Optionally a preferred revision can be included, which will be
used if no other revision information is set.
constructors.summary: Creates a new Launcher instance in the specified project_root.

instance_methods.name: exit_handlers
instance_methods.doc: Array of handlers to call on browser exit
instance_methods.summary: Array of handlers to call on browser exit

instance_methods.name: launch
instance_methods.doc:
Launch a `Broswer` instance with the specified options. Configuration
options include:

- **address** - The address that Firefox is listening on. (default: 127.0.0.1)
- **port** - The port that Firefox is listening on. (default: 2828)
- **executable** - The executable to launch. If `nil` an executable will be searched for. If `false` no executable will be launched.
- **args** - Arguments to pass to the Firefox process (only if **executable** is not false)
- **profile** - User profile path to launch with (only if **executable** is not false)
- **headless** - Launch browser in headless mode (default: true) (only if **executable** is not false)
- **stdout** - `IO` to use for STDOUT (only if **executable** is not false)
- **stderr** - `IO` to use for STDERR (only if **executable** is not false)
- **accept_insecure_certs** - Open all connections, even if the cert is invalid
- **env** - Environment to pass to `Process` (only if **executable** is not false)
- **default_viewport** - Default size of the browser window (default: {width: 800, height: 600})
- **timeout** - Universal timeout (default: 60000)
- **proxy** - NamedTuple with `address` and `port` for proxy.
instance_methods.summary: Launch a Broswer instance with the specified options.
instance_methods.args_string: (address = "127.0.0.1", port = 2828, args = [] of String, profile = nil, console = false, headless = true, executable = nil, stdout = nil, stderr = nil, accept_insecure_certs = false, env = nil, default_viewport = {width: 800, height: 600}, timeout = 30000, proxy = nil)

def.name: launch
def.body:
if executable.nil?
  executable = resolve_executable_path
end
proxy = proxy ? {proxyType: "manual", httpProxy: "#{proxy[:address]}:#{proxy[:port]}", sslProxy: "#{proxy[:address]}:#{proxy[:port]}", socksProxy: "#{proxy[:address]}:#{proxy[:port]}"} : {proxyType: "direct"}
capabilities = {acceptInsecureCerts: accept_insecure_certs, proxy: proxy, timeouts: {implicit: timeout, pageLoad: timeout, script: timeout}}
if executable
  debug("Launching browser")
  args.concat(DEFAULT_ARGS)
  if headless
    args << "--headless"
  end
  if console
    args << "--jsdebugger"
  end
  if profile
    args << "--profile #{profile}"
  end
  args << ("--window-size {width},{height}" % default_viewport)
  stdout || (stdout = Process::ORIGINAL_STDOUT)
  stderr || (stderr = Process::ORIGINAL_STDERR)
  Process.new(executable.to_s, args, env, output: stdout, error: stderr)
end
browser = Browser.new(address, port, timeout)
browser.new_session(capabilities)
browser

instance_methods.name: resolve_executable_path
instance_methods.doc:
Get the path to the executable using, in order of importance:

- `ENV["MARIONETTE_EXECUTABLE_PATH"]`
- `ENV["MARIONETTE_REVISION"]`
- `@preferred_revision`
- `PATH`
instance_methods.summary: Get the path to the executable using, in order of importance:

def.name: resolve_executable_path
def.body:
if executable_path = ENV["MARIONETTE_EXECUTABLE_PATH"]?
  absolute_path = File.expand_path(executable_path, "/home/watzon/Projects/personal/marionette/src/marionette")
  if File.executable?(absolute_path)
  else
    raise("Tried to use MARIONETTE_EXECUTABLE_PATH env variable to launch browser but did not find any executable at: #{executable_path}")
  end
  debug("Using firefox executable at #{absolute_path}")
  return absolute_path
else
  on_path = Utils.which("firefox")
  if on_path
    debug("Using firefox executable at #{on_path}")
    return on_path
  else
    error = "Firefox executable could not be found. Please do one of the following:\n  - set the executable option in Launcher#new\n  - set the MARIONETTE_EXECUTABLE_PATH environment variable\n  - set the MARIONETTE_REVISION environment variable to a downloaded revision\n  - install Firefox using your package manager and make sure it exists on your PATH"
    crit(error)
    raise(Error::ExecutableNotFound.new(error))
  end
end

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(type, id, command, params)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end

def.body:
begin
  params.as_nil
  return false
rescue
  return true
end

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Creates a new Transport instance with the
provided `timeout`.
constructors.summary: Creates a new Transport instance with the provided #timeout.

instance_methods.name: connect
instance_methods.doc:
Initiates a TCP connection to a running Firefox instance
using the provided `address` and `port`.
instance_methods.summary: Initiates a TCP connection to a running Firefox instance using the provided address and port.

def.name: connect
def.body:
debug("Attempting TCP connection at #{address}:#{port}")
try_connect(address, port, @timeout)
begin
  response = JSON.parse(receive_raw)
rescue Error::TimeoutError
  raise(Error::TimeoutError.new("Connection attempt failed because no data has been received over the socket"))
end
application_type = response["applicationType"].as_s
protocol = response["marionetteProtocol"].as_i
if application_type != "gecko"
  raise("Application type '#{application_type}' is not supported")
end
if protocol < min_protocol_level
  raise("Earliest supported protocol is '#{min_protocol_level}', but got '#{protocol}'")
end
{protocol: protocol, application_type: application_type}

instance_methods.name: receive
instance_methods.doc:
Receives a message from the browser following
a command and parses it into a `Message` instance.
instance_methods.summary: Receives a message from the browser following a command and parses it into a Message instance.

def.name: receive
def.body:
raw = receive_raw
type, id, command, params = (JSON.parse(raw)).as_a
Message.new(type.as_i, id.as_i, command.as_s?, params)

instance_methods.name: receive_raw
instance_methods.doc:
Receives a message from the browser following
a command and returns the raw string.
TODO: Add timeout
instance_methods.summary: Receives a message from the browser following a command and returns the raw string.

def.name: receive_raw
def.body:
now = Time.now
data = ""
len = ((socket.gets(':')).to_s.chomp(':')).to_i
while !(data.bytesize == len)
  remaining = len - data.bytesize
  num_bytes = [@max_packet_length, remaining].min
  data = data + (socket.read_string(num_bytes))
end
data

instance_methods.name: request
instance_methods.doc:
Convenience method to `send` a command with
optional `params` and `receive` a `Message`
response.
instance_methods.summary: Convenience method to #send a command with optional params and #receive a Message response.

instance_methods.name: send
instance_methods.doc:
Sends a `command` to the browser with optional
`params` supplied as any object that can be
converted to json via `#to_json`.
instance_methods.summary: Sends a command to the browser with optional params supplied as any object that can be converted to json via #to_json.

def.name: send
def.body:
msg_id = @last_id = @last_id + 1
params || (params = {} of String => String)
data = params.to_json
payload = [0, msg_id, command, params]
json = payload.to_json
socket.send("#{json.bytesize}:#{json}")

def.name: timeout
def.body:
start = Time.now
channel = Channel(Bool).new
spawn do
  while !Time.now > (start + time.milliseconds)
  end
  channel.send(false)
end
spawn do
  block.call
  channel.send(true)
end
if channel.receive
else
  raise(Error::TimeoutError.new)
end

def.name: which
def.body:
exts = ENV["PATHEXT"]? ? ENV["PATHEXT"].split(";") : [""]
(ENV["PATH"].split(':')).each do |path|
  exts.each do |ext|
    exe = File.join(path, "#{cmd}#{ext}")
    if File.executable?(exe)
      return exe
    end
  end
end
nil

def.name: new
def.body:
instance = allocate
instance.initialize(__pull_for_json_serializable: pull)
if instance.responds_to?(:finalize)
  GC.add_finalizer(instance)
end
instance
